snippet: Under a settlement to be announced Friday, half of all new medallion taxis put into service in a given year must be wheelchair accessible until the goal of 50 percent of the city’s fleet is reached.
abstract: New York City agrees to settle major class-action lawsuit filed under federal Americans With Disabilities Act, and adopt regulations requiring that half of city's more than 13,000 yellow cabs be wheelchair accessible within six years.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and MATT FLEGENHEIMER

lead_paragraph: Under a settlement to be announced Friday, half of all new medallion taxis put into service in a given year must be wheelchair accessible until the goal of 50 percent of the city’s fleet is reached.

headline.main: City Agrees on Access to Taxis for Disabled
headline.print_headline: City Agrees On Access To Taxis For Disabled
